body: Tentatively slated for 5.5 M2 for _team discussion_

rename.to: Consider removing runtime scope on `junit:junit` from the Vintage engine

body: Didn't make up my mind, yet -- but we need to take into account, that JUnit 4 `junit:junit` is the mandated API for the Vintage engine. Additional background regarding `runtime` scope usages in Maven and Gradle by the Jupiter engine: https://sormuras.github.io/blog/2018-12-26-junit-jupiter-aggregator.html#usage-with-gradle-5

### Jupiter `pom.xml`  w/o versions
```xml
  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apiguardian</groupId>
      <artifactId>apiguardian-api</artifactId>
      <scope>compile</scope>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.junit.platform</groupId>
      <artifactId>junit-platform-engine</artifactId>
      <scope>compile</scope>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
      <artifactId>junit-jupiter-api</artifactId>
      <scope>compile</scope>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>
```

### Vintage `pom.xml` w/o versions
```xml
  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apiguardian</groupId>
      <artifactId>apiguardian-api</artifactId>
      <scope>compile</scope>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.junit.platform</groupId>
      <artifactId>junit-platform-engine</artifactId>
      <scope>compile</scope>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>junit</groupId>
      <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
      <scope>runtime</scope> <!-- *** this should be compile *** -->
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>
```

I made up my mind. Let's do it as requested by @snicoll.
@sormuras @sbrannen  I would like to pick-up this if it's up-for-graps?
It's still scheduled for team discussion, which will happen on Friday.

issue.title: Improve build model to be able to exclude a transitive dependency

repository.name: initializr
repository.description: A quickstart generator for Spring projects

issue.body: To provide a more idiomatic experience with Spring Boot 2.2 and JUnit 5 we should exclude the vintage engine (and JUnit 4 as long as [this issue](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/1872) is not fixed). The current model does not allow us to exclude a dependency.

issue.title: Upgrade to JUnit Jupiter 5.5.0-RC2

repository.name: spring-boot
repository.description: Spring Boot helps you to create Spring-powered, production-grade applications and services with absolute minimum fuss.

issue.body: This also gives us an opportunity to simplify the build setup required to exclude the vintage engine now that https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/1872 has been fixed.
